verses.sanskrit:
त्रिदलं त्रिगुणाकारं त्रिनेत्रं च त्रियायुधम्।
त्रिजन्मपापसंहारं एकबिल्वं शिवार्पणम्॥
verses.transliteration:
tridalaṃ triguṇākāraṃ trinetraṃ ca triyāyudham।
trijanmapāpasaṃhāraṃ ekabilvaṃ śivārpaṇam॥
verses.meaning: The Bilva leaf has three leaflets representing the three gunas (qualities), the three eyes of Shiva, and His three weapons. Offering even one Bilva leaf to Lord Shiva destroys the sins of three births.

verses.sanskrit:
त्रिशाखैः बिल्वपत्रैश्च अच्छिद्रैः कोमलैः शुभैः।
शिवपूजां करिष्यामि एकबिल्वं शिवार्पणम्॥
verses.transliteration:
triśākhaiḥ bilvapatraiśca acchidraiḥ komalaiḥ śubhaiḥ।
śivapūjāṃ kariṣyāmi ekabilvaṃ śivārpaṇam॥
verses.meaning: I shall worship Lord Shiva with tender, unbroken, auspicious Bilva leaves with three branches. Offering even one Bilva leaf to Shiva is supremely beneficial.

verses.sanskrit:
अखण्डबिल्वपत्रेण पूजितः नन्दिकेश्वरः।
शुद्ध्यन्ति सर्वपापेभ्यः एकबिल्वं शिवार्पणम्॥
verses.transliteration:
akhaṇḍabilvapatreṇa pūjitaḥ nandikeśvaraḥ।
śuddhyanti sarvapāpebhyaḥ ekabilvaṃ śivārpaṇam॥
verses.meaning: When Lord Nandikeshwara (Shiva) is worshipped with an unbroken Bilva leaf, one is purified from all sins. Offering even one Bilva leaf to Shiva is most sacred.

verses.sanskrit:
शिवाय प्रियतमं बिल्वं प्रियं शङ्करस्य च।
बिल्वव्रतं तु यः कुर्यात् स भवेद् बिल्ववृक्षवत्॥
verses.transliteration:
śivāya priyatamaṃ bilvaṃ priyaṃ śaṅkarasya ca।
bilvavrata ṃ tu yaḥ kuryāt sa bhaved bilvavṛkṣavat॥
verses.meaning: The Bilva is most dear to Lord Shiva and beloved of Shankara. One who observes the Bilva vow (ritual) becomes as sacred as the Bilva tree itself.

verses.sanskrit:
दर्शनं बिल्ववृक्षस्य स्पर्शनं पापनाशनम्।
अघोरपापसंहारं एकबिल्वं शिवार्पणम्॥
verses.transliteration:
darśanaṃ bilvavṛkṣasya sparśanaṃ pāpanāśanam।
aghorapāpasaṃhāraṃ ekabilvaṃ śivārpaṇam॥
verses.meaning: Even seeing the Bilva tree removes sins, and touching it destroys sins. Offering even one Bilva leaf to Shiva destroys the most terrible sins.

verses.sanskrit:
लक्ष्म्याश्च स्थानं महादेव्याः सदा वासं प्रकुर्वते।
बिल्वमूले वसन्तीह सर्वे देवास्त्रिमूर्तयः॥
verses.transliteration:
lakṣmyāśca sthānaṃ mahādevyāḥ sadā vāsaṃ prakurvate।
bilvamūle vasantīha sarve devāstrimūrtayaḥ॥
verses.meaning: Goddess Lakshmi and the great Goddess permanently reside at the Bilva tree. All the gods and the holy trinity (Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva) dwell at the root of the Bilva tree.

verses.sanskrit:
मूलतो ब्रह्मरूपाय मध्यतो विष्णुरूपिणे।
अग्रतः शिवरूपाय बिल्ववृक्षाय ते नमः॥
verses.transliteration:
mūlato brahmarūpāya madhyato viṣṇurūpiṇe।
agrataḥ śivarūpāya bilvavṛkṣāya te namaḥ॥
verses.meaning: Salutations to the Bilva tree, whose root represents Brahma, whose middle represents Vishnu, and whose top represents Shiva. The entire tree embodies the holy trinity.

verses.sanskrit:
बिल्वाष्टकमिदं पुण्यं यः पठेच्छिवसन्निधौ।
शिवलोकमवाप्नोति शिवेन सह मोदते॥
verses.transliteration:
bilvāṣṭakamidaṃ puṇyaṃ yaḥ paṭhecchivasannidhau।
śivalokamavāpnoti śivena saha modate॥
verses.meaning: One who recites this sacred Bilvashtakam in the presence of Lord Shiva attains the abode of Shiva and rejoices eternally with Him.
